text: February unemployment rates ranged from 2.1% in NE and UT to 5.6% in NM.
In Q4 2021, eight states saw their greatest annual house price growth in three decades.
GDP growth between Q4 2020 and Q4 2021 ranged from 0.0% in Alaska to 8.8% in Hawaii.
Average private weekly earnings in February ranged from $824 in MS to $1,298 in MA.
Leisure and hospitality jobs in February were above prepandemic levels in only four states.
February state and local public education jobs were above prepandemic levels in only ID.
In Q4 2021, manufacturing GDP was above Q4 2019 levels in WI and 41 other states.
Every state (but not DC) saw annual house price increases exceed 10% in Q4 2021.
In February 2022, nine states saw their lowest unemployment rates in 45 years.
In Q4 2021, retail GDP was above Q4 2019 levels in only WA and seven other states.
